columns.text: In this exercise, we will calculate the value of an annuity today, three and five years from now. If the annuity is five years, $5,900 semi-annually starts nine years from now with a discount rate of 8% monthly compounded.

We will consider the following detail from the problem. 

| Particulars          |        |
|----------------------|--------|
| Constant payment     | $5,900 |
| Rate                 | 8%     |
| Period (semi-annual) | 10     |




Note that the period of five years is multiplied by two since the annuity is semi-annual; hence, the period is ten.

First, let's identify the effective annual rate of the annuity and how it is calculated.

The Effective Annual Rate refers to a loan's annual interest rate after considering the nominal interest rate and the compounding of periods. The EAR calculation assumes the APR and the compounding period of a loan. Hence, we will consider the annual percentage rate we calculated from the previous steps. The EAR can be calculated using the following equation:

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{EAR} &=\left(1+\dfrac{APR}{m}\right)^m-1
\end{aligned}$$

Where:

$EAR$, which means the effective annual rate\
$APR$, which refers to the annual percentage rate\
$m$, which refers to the compounding period

Let's now calculate the effective annual rate of the annuity using the 8% APR and the period of six since the annuity is semi-annual.

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{EAR} &=\left(1+\dfrac{0.08}{12}\right)^{6}-1
\\[10pt]
 &=\left(1+0.006666667\right)^{6}-1
\\[5pt]
 &=1.006666667^{6}-1
\\[5pt]
&= \boxed{\bf{4.067\%}}
\end{aligned}$$

Therefore, as can be seen in our calculation, the effective annual rate is 4.067%.

Next, considering the effective annual rate of 4.067%, calculate the present value of the annuity with the constant cash flow of $5,900 sem-annual.

The present value annuity refers to the cash value of an annuity calculated based on the constant future payment multiplied by the discount rate factor and the compounding of periods.

The present value of an annuity can be calculated using the following equation:

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Present Value of an Annuity} &=C\times\dfrac{1-\dfrac{1}{\left(1+r\right)^t}}{r}
\end{aligned}$$

Where:

$C$, which represent the cash amount or the constant payment\
$r$, which refers to the rate\
$t$, which symbolizes the period
Next, since the annuity will begin nine years from now, we will consider the present value of the annuity as the future value and calculate the present value of the annuity five years from now.

In calculating the present value of a future value, we will  use the following formula:
$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Present Value} &=\dfrac{{FV}_{t}}{\left(1 + r\right)^{t}}
\end{aligned}$$

Where:

$PV$, which means the present value\
$FV$, which refers to the future value\
$t$, which represent the period\
$r$, which indicate the discount rate

We will use the period of eight since the calculation is five years from now, and the annuity starts after nine years. Therefore, the semi-annual period between the fiftth and the ninth year is the period to be discounted.

For the next calculation, we'll identify the present value of the annuity three years from now.

The period between the third year and the ninth year, when the annuity starts, is six years multiplied by two; since the annuity is semi-annual, the period to be discounted is 12.

For the last calculation, we'll determine the value of the annuity today.

Since the annuity starts nine years, multiply the years by two since the annuity is semi-annual. Hence the period to discount to determine the value today of the annuity is 18.
To deduce, the value of the five-year semi-annual annuity if it starts nine years from now is $23,272.28, $29,560.86 if it starts three years from now, and $34,671.23 five years from now.
In this problem, we will solve for the present value of the given investment as well as its value 3 years and 5 years from now.

Since the given rate is the annual rate, we will divide it by $12$ to get the monthly rate.

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{rate}&=\dfrac{0.08}{12}\\[15 pt]
&=0.0067
\end{aligned}$$

The monthly rate is $0.0067$

Now that we have the monthly rate,  we will solve for the semiannual rate. Semiannual means that there are $6$ compounding terms in a given year. To solve for the semiannual rate, we can use this formula:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Semiannual rate}&=(1+\text{rate})^6-1\\[15 pt]
&=(1+0.0067)^6-1\\[15 pt]
&=0.0409
\end{aligned}$$

The semiannual rate for this problem is $0.0409$

Now to solve for the present value at the end of $9$ years, we can simply substitute the given values to the formula in Step 2:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Present value}&=\$5,900 \times\dfrac{1-\left(\frac{1}{(1+0.0409)^{10}}\right)}{0.0409}\\[15 pt]
&=\$47,640.60
\end{aligned}$$

The present value of the investment at the end of the $9th$ year is $\$47,640.60$

To solve for the present value of the investment $5$ years from now, we can substitute the values to the formula in Step 6. For the future value, we will solve for the value solved in Step 5. We will also use $\text{t}=8$ since there are $4$ years left and in the those years, there are $8$ compounding periods. 

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Present value}&=\dfrac{\$47,640.60}{(1+0.0409)^8}\\[15 pt]
&=\$34,570.46
\end{aligned}$$

The present value of the investment $5$ years from now is $\$34,570.46$

The same concept will be used to solve for the present value $3$ years from now. For the time, we will use $\text{t}=12$ since there are $6$ years remaining from the $9$ years and in those years there are $12$ compounding periods.

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Present value}&=\dfrac{\$47,640.60}{(1+0.0409)^{12}}\\[15 pt]
&=\$29,448.90
\end{aligned}$$

The present value of the investment $3$ years from now is $\$29,448.90$

Finally, to solve for the present value  the current year, we will use $\text{t}=18$ since there are $18$ compounding periods in $9$ years.

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Present value}&=\dfrac{\$47,640.60}{(1+0.0409)^{18}}\\[15 pt]
&=\$23,153.42
\end{aligned}$$

The present value of the investment currently is $\$23,153.42$
